description: From Middle English heleles, equivalent to heal (“health, well-being”) +‎ -less. Compare healful.

adjectives.description: healless (comparative more healless, superlative most healless)

entries.meaning: Incapable of being made whole or well; cureless; incurable; unhealable.
examples: A capacity for sin so healless that it makes its man despair from his heart of redemption - that is the true theological way to salvation.
